listSubscribe

public boolean listSubscribe(java.lang.String listId,
                             java.lang.String emailAddress,
                             MergeFieldListUtil mergeFields,
                             Constants.EmailType emailType,
                             java.lang.Boolean doubleOptIn,
                             java.lang.Boolean updateExisting,
                             java.lang.Boolean replaceInterests,
                             java.lang.Boolean sendWelcome)
                      throws MailChimpApiException
Wraps method http://www.mailchimp.com/api/rtfm/listsubscribe.func.php
Subscribe a single user to a list

Parameters:
listId - the id of the list, see getLists()
emailAddress - the email address to subscribe
mergeFields - the merge fields and values for the person to subscribe
emailType - one of the constant enums from Constants.EmailType, if null will default to the server's default (currently 'html')
doubleOptIn - if false, will subscribe without the double opt-in. please use this carefully, if abused, this can result in account suspension. if null, defaults to true
updateExisting - if true, will update the existing user. if false or null and the user exists, this call will throw an exception
replaceInterests - if true, will replace the interests for the user, otherwise it will not. if null, defaults to false
sendWelcome - if false, will not send the welcome message. if null, defaults to true
Returns:
Throws:
MailChimpApiException

listUnsubscribe

public boolean listUnsubscribe(java.lang.String listId,
                               java.lang.String emailAddress)
                        throws MailChimpApiException
Wraps method http://www.mailchimp.com/api/rtfm/listunsubscribe.func.php
Convenience method for unsubscribing a user, same as calling listUnsubscribe(listId, emailAddress, null, null, null);

Parameters:
listId -
emailAddress -
Returns:
Throws:
MailChimpApiException

listUnsubscribe

public boolean listUnsubscribe(java.lang.String listId,
                               java.lang.String emailAddress,
                               java.lang.Boolean deleteMember,
                               java.lang.Boolean sendGoodbye,
                               java.lang.Boolean sendNotify)
                        throws MailChimpApiException
Wraps method http://www.mailchimp.com/api/rtfm/listunsubscribe.func.php
Unsubscribe a user from a list

Parameters:
listId - the list id to unsubscribe from, see getLists()
emailAddress - the email address of the user to unsubscribe
deleteMember - if true, will delete the member instead of just marking them as unsubscribed. if null, defaults to false
sendGoodbye - if true, will send the goodbye email. if null, defaults to true
sendNotify - if true, will send the unsubscribe email to the list owner notifying them a user has unsubscribed. if null, defaults to true
Returns:
Throws:
MailChimpApiException

                                       java.lang.Boolean doubleOptIn,
                                       java.lang.Boolean updateExisting,
                                       java.lang.Boolean replaceInterests)
                                throws MailChimpApiException
Wraps method http://www.mailchimp.com/api/rtfm/listbatchsubscribe.func.php
Method to batch subscribe a list of emails. The list of emails to add are passed as a list of MergeField instances. Make sure the addEmail() method has been called on each MergeField instance

toSubscribe -

updateExisting -

public BatchResults listBatchUnsubscribe(java.lang.String listId,
                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> toUnsubscribe)
                                  throws MailChimpApiException
Wraps method http://www.mailchimp.com/api/rtfm/listbatchunsubscribe.func.php

Parameters:

listBatchUnsubscribe

public BatchResults listBatchUnsubscribe(java.lang.String listId,
                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> toUnsubscribe,
                                         java.lang.Boolean deleteMember,
                                         java.lang.Boolean sendGoodbye,
                                         java.lang.Boolean sendNotify)
                                  throws MailChimpApiException
Wraps method http://www.mailchimp.com/api/rtfm/listbatchunsubscribe.func.php
To batch unsubscribe a list of emails from a list.

Parameters:
listId -
toUnsubscribe - just a list of the Strings representing each email address
deleteMember - if true, deletes the member instead of keeping them and unsubscribing them, if null, uses the server default.
sendGoodbye - if true, sends the user a goodbye message. if null, uses the server default.
sendNotify - if true, sends the list owner a notification of the unsubscribes. if null, uses the server default.
Returns:
Throws:
MailChimpApiException

                                             throws MailChimpApiException
Wraps method http://www.mailchimp.com/api/rtfm/listmergevars.func.php
Returns a list of merge variables for a given list, as a List of MergeFieldInfo instances (these have much more detail than MergeFieldOptions)

Parameters:
listId -
Returns:
an empty list if there are no merge fields (though, there should always be at least one - email!)

MailChimpApiException

listWebhookAdd

public boolean listWebhookAdd(java.lang.String listId,
                              java.lang.String url,
                              java.lang.Integer actionsFlag,
                              java.lang.Integer sourcesFlag)
                       throws MailChimpApiException
Wraps method http://www.mailchimp.com/api/rtfm/listwebhookadd.func.php
Adds a web hook.

Parameters:
listId -
url - (note this will be validated by the API)
actionsFlag - - provide a bitwise OR field of values Constants.WEBHOOK_ACTION_XXX. If null, will use server defaults
sourcesFlag - - provide a bitwise OR field of values Constants.WEBHOOK_SOURCE_XXX. If null, will use server defaults
Returns:
Throws:
MailChimpApiException
